reviews.review_msg: Gary's a knowledgable and kind man. He lectures straight through and it's mostly on his own theories (poli-econ based), which was a disappointing for a class on classical theory. Though he can say some interesting things, but he repeats himself A LOT, so it's not necessary to go to all classes. Bonus- You can read/write about whatever you want!

Shes nice and knowledgeable about what she teaches, but this was one of the worst sociology classes Ive taken at SFU. Her lectures had no structure, often going back and forth between 2 different PowerPoints in a class, she graded you based on criteria never given in assignment guidelines, and graded you based on the work of other classmates. Ugh

she's a prof that is clearly passionate about her topics however tends to go on long tangents and doesn't often break down the material. With this class the material is very dry and dense therefore just the readings on its own is hard to comprehend. Her feedback on papers were very negative & not helpful. She also did not have any set out lec notes

The length and difficulty of the readings & how many readings there are, is completely unreasonable, esp for 3rd year. She is very cold and will not talk about/negotiate grades. The criteria for the summaries and critical journals are VERY important, if you make a mistake she will give NO sympathy. Repetitive lectures.
Kind and caring woman who pushes you to expand your critical thinking further.

Soul destroying course with a professor who was hellbent on making it the worst experience of my lifetime. I had to report her to the Dean and Associate Dean of Arts and Social Sciences.  Changes policies and course outline to suit her own agenda. Avoid at all costs. You will get a bad mark and will hate sociology.

This course is highly politically-focused and reading intensive. I found it difficult to sit through 4 hours of being talked at. Yildiz is highly knowledgeable about theorists of sociology, and though she encourages discussion, I found her demeanor discouraging as she tends to argue against students' thoughts somewhat aggressively.

This is my 2nd time taking a class with Yildiz. I have always enjoyed her classes and I try to work harder because I don't want to let her down. Very helpful during office hours. Class structure: 2x journals (easy if u put time in), presentation, presenting news & 5 news article summaries related w/ course concepts (found this to be annoying).
